alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL AROOSTOOK COUNTY THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eagle Lake, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, New Canada, Cross Lake, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Winterville, Daigle, Soldier Pond, Saint Agatha, and Saint John. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Madawaska and Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Eagle Lake and Fort Kent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Be alert for ponding water on roadways.
